parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description: The ETag of the resource. Omit this value to always overwrite the current record set. Specify the last-seen ETag value to prevent accidentally overwriting concurrent changes.

parameters.name: if-none-match
parameters.description: Set to '*' to allow a new resource to be created, but to prevent updating an existing record set. Other values will result in a 412 Pre-condition Failed response.

parameters.description: The name of the cluster.

parameters.description: The definition of the cluster that will be used to create a new cluster or replace the existing one.

get.description: Lists all of the streaming jobs in the specified resource group.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: The $expand OData query parameter. This is a comma-separated list of additional streaming job properties to include in the response, beyond the default set returned when this parameter is absent. The default set is all streaming job properties other than 'inputs', 'transformation', 'outputs', and 'functions'.

get.description: Lists all of the functions under the specified streaming job.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: The $select OData query parameter. This is a comma-separated list of structural properties to include in the response, or "*" to include all properties. By default, all properties are returned except diagnostics. Currently only accepts '*' as a valid value.

parameters.name: jobName
parameters.description: The name of the streaming job.

parameters.name: jobName
parameters.description: The name of the streaming job.

parameters.name: functionName
parameters.description: The name of the function.

put.description: Creates a function or replaces an already existing function under an existing streaming job.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description: The ETag of the function. Omit this value to always overwrite the current function. Specify the last-seen ETag value to prevent accidentally overwriting concurrent changes.

parameters.name: if-none-match
parameters.description: Set to '*' to allow a new function to be created, but to prevent updating an existing function. Other values will result in a 412 Pre-condition Failed response.

parameters.name: jobName
parameters.description: The name of the streaming job.

parameters.name: functionName
parameters.description: The name of the function.

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: The definition of the function that will be used to create a new function or replace the existing one under the streaming job.

delete.description: Deletes a function from the streaming job.

parameters.description: The name of the streaming job.

parameters.name: functionName
parameters.description: The name of the function.

patch.description: Updates an existing function under an existing streaming job. This can be used to partially update (ie. update one or two properties) a function without affecting the rest the job or function definition.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description: The ETag of the function. Omit this value to always overwrite the current function. Specify the last-seen ETag value to prevent accidentally overwriting concurrent changes.

parameters.name: jobName
parameters.description: The name of the streaming job.

parameters.name: functionName
parameters.description: The name of the function.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the function.

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: A function object. The properties specified here will overwrite the corresponding properties in the existing function (ie. Those properties will be updated). Any properties that are set to null here will mean that the corresponding property in the existing function will remain the same and not change as a result of this PATCH operation.

post.description: Retrieves the default definition of a function based on the parameters specified.

parameters.name: jobName
parameters.description: The name of the streaming job.

parameters.name: functionName
parameters.description: The name of the function.

parameters.name: functionRetrieveDefaultDefinitionParameters
parameters.description: Parameters used to specify the type of function to retrieve the default definition for.

post.description: Tests if the information provided for a function is valid. This can range from testing the connection to the underlying web service behind the function or making sure the function code provided is syntactically correct.

parameters.name: jobName
parameters.description: The name of the streaming job.

parameters.name: functionName
parameters.description: The name of the function.

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: If the function specified does not already exist, this parameter must contain the full function definition intended to be tested. If the function specified already exists, this parameter can be left null to test the existing function as is or if specified, the properties specified will overwrite the corresponding properties in the existing function (exactly like a PATCH operation) and the resulting function will be tested.

AggregateFunctionProperties.description: The properties that are associated with an aggregate function.

AuthenticationMode.description: Authentication Mode. Valid modes are `ConnectionString`, `Msi` and 'UserToken'.

AvroSerialization.description: Describes how data from an input is serialized or how data is serialized when written to an output in Avro format.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with the Avro serialization type. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

AzureDataLakeStoreOutputDataSource.description: Describes an Azure Data Lake Store output data source.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure Data Lake Store output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

AzureDataLakeStoreOutputDataSourceProper.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure Data Lake Store.

accountName.description: The name of the Azure Data Lake Store account. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the user used to obtain the refresh token. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

filePathPrefix.description: The location of the file to which the output should be written to. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

dateFormat.description: The date format. Wherever {date} appears in filePathPrefix, the value of this property is used as the date format instead.

timeFormat.description: The time format. Wherever {time} appears in filePathPrefix, the value of this property is used as the time format instead.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with a Azure Function output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

AzureFunctionOutputDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure Function output.

functionAppName.description: The name of your Azure Functions app.

functionName.description: The name of the function in your Azure Functions app.

apiKey.description: If you want to use an Azure Function from another subscription, you can do so by providing the key to access your function.

maxBatchSize.description: A property that lets you set the maximum size for each output batch that's sent to your Azure function. The input unit is in bytes. By default, this value is 262,144 bytes (256 KB).

maxBatchCount.description: A property that lets you specify the maximum number of events in each batch that's sent to Azure Functions. The default value is 100.

AzureMachineLearningServiceFunctionBindi.description: The binding to an Azure Machine Learning web service.

properties.description: The binding properties associated with an Azure Machine learning web service.

AzureMachineLearningServiceFunctionBindi.description: The binding properties associated with an Azure Machine learning web service.

endpoint.description: The Request-Response execute endpoint of the Azure Machine Learning web service.

apiKey.description: The API key used to authenticate with Request-Response endpoint.

inputs.description: The inputs for the Azure Machine Learning web service endpoint.

outputs.description: A list of outputs from the Azure Machine Learning web service endpoint execution.

batchSize.description: Number between 1 and 10000 describing maximum number of rows for every Azure ML RRS execute request. Default is 1000.

numberOfParallelRequests.description: The number of parallel requests that will be sent per partition of your job to the machine learning service. Default is 1.

inputRequestName.description: Label for the input request object.

outputResponseName.description: Label for the output request object.

AzureMachineLearningServiceFunctionBindi.description: The binding retrieval properties associated with an Azure Machine learning web service.

executeEndpoint.description: The Request-Response execute endpoint of the Azure Machine Learning web service.

AzureMachineLearningServiceFunctionRetri.description: The parameters needed to retrieve the default function definition for an Azure Machine Learning web service function.

bindingRetrievalProperties.description: The binding retrieval properties associated with an Azure Machine learning web service.

name.description: The name of the input column.

dataType.description: The (Azure Machine Learning supported) data type of the input column.

mapTo.description: The zero based index of the function parameter this input maps to.

name.description: The name of the input. This is the name provided while authoring the endpoint.

AzureSqlDatabaseDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure SQL database data source.

server.description: The name of the SQL server containing the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

database.description: The name of the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

user.description: The user name that will be used to connect to the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

password.description: The password that will be used to connect to the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

table.description: The name of the table in the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

maxBatchCount.description: Max Batch count for write to Sql database, the default value is 10,000. Optional on PUT requests.

maxWriterCount.description: Max Writer count, currently only 1(single writer) and 0(based on query partition) are available. Optional on PUT requests.

AzureSqlDatabaseOutputDataSource.description: Describes an Azure SQL database output data source.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure SQL database output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

AzureSqlDatabaseOutputDataSourceProperti.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure SQL database output.

AzureSqlReferenceInputDataSource.description: Describes an Azure SQL database reference input data source.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with SQL DB input containing reference data. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

AzureSqlReferenceInputDataSourceProperti.description: The properties that are associated with SQL DB input containing reference data. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

server.description: This element is associated with the datasource element. This is the name of the server that contains the database that will be written to.

database.description: This element is associated with the datasource element. This is the name of the database that output will be written to.

user.description: This element is associated with the datasource element. This is the user name that will be used to connect to the SQL Database instance.

password.description: This element is associated with the datasource element. This is the password that will be used to connect to the SQL Database instance.

refreshType.description: Indicates the type of data refresh option.

refreshRate.description: This element is associated with the datasource element. This indicates how frequently the data will be fetched from the database. It is of DateTime format.

fullSnapshotQuery.description: This element is associated with the datasource element. This query is used to fetch data from the sql database.

deltaSnapshotQuery.description: This element is associated with the datasource element. This query is used to fetch incremental changes from the SQL database. To use this option, we recommend using temporal tables in Azure SQL Database.

AzureSynapseDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure SQL database data source.

server.description: The name of the SQL server containing the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

database.description: The name of the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

table.description: The name of the table in the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

user.description: The user name that will be used to connect to the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

password.description: The password that will be used to connect to the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

AzureSynapseOutputDataSource.description: Describes an Azure Synapse output data source.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure Synapse output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

AzureSynapseOutputDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure Synapse output.

AzureTableOutputDataSource.description: Describes an Azure Table output data source.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure Table output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

AzureTableOutputDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure Table output.

accountName.description: The name of the Azure Storage account. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

accountKey.description: The account key for the Azure Storage account. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

table.description: The name of the Azure Table. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

partitionKey.description: This element indicates the name of a column from the SELECT statement in the query that will be used as the partition key for the Azure Table. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

rowKey.description: This element indicates the name of a column from the SELECT statement in the query that will be used as the row key for the Azure Table. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

columnsToRemove.description: If specified, each item in the array is the name of a column to remove (if present) from output event entities.

batchSize.description: The number of rows to write to the Azure Table at a time.

BlobDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a blob data source.

storageAccounts.description: A list of one or more Azure Storage accounts. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

container.description: The name of a container within the associated Storage account. This container contains either the blob(s) to be read from or written to. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

pathPattern.description: The blob path pattern. Not a regular expression. It represents a pattern against which blob names will be matched to determine whether or not they should be included as input or output to the job. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/streamanalytics/stream-analytics-input or https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/streamanalytics/stream-analytics-output for a more detailed explanation and example.

dateFormat.description: The date format. Wherever {date} appears in pathPattern, the value of this property is used as the date format instead.

timeFormat.description: The time format. Wherever {time} appears in pathPattern, the value of this property is used as the time format instead.

BlobOutputDataSource.description: Describes a blob output data source.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with a blob output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

BlobOutputDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a blob output.

BlobReferenceInputDataSource.description: Describes a blob input data source that contains reference data.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with a blob input containing reference data. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

BlobReferenceInputDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a blob input containing reference data.

blobName.description: The name of the blob input.

deltaPathPattern.description: The path pattern of the delta snapshot.

sourcePartitionCount.description: The partition count of the blob input data source. Range 1 - 256.

fullSnapshotRefreshRate.description: The refresh interval of the blob input data source.

deltaSnapshotRefreshRate.description: The interval that the user generates a delta snapshot of this reference blob input data source.

BlobStreamInputDataSource.description: Describes a blob input data source that contains stream data.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with a blob input containing stream data. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

BlobStreamInputDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a blob input containing stream data.

sourcePartitionCount.description: The partition count of the blob input data source. Range 1 - 1024.

BlobWriteMode.description: Determines whether blob blocks are either committed automatically or appended.

CSharpFunctionBinding.description: The binding to a CSharp function.

properties.description: The binding properties associated with a CSharp function.

CSharpFunctionBindingProperties.description: The binding properties associated with a CSharp function.

dllPath.description: The Csharp code containing a single function definition.

class.description: The Csharp code containing a single function definition.

method.description: The Csharp code containing a single function definition.

updateMode.description: Refresh modes for Stream Analytics functions.

CSharpFunctionBindingRetrievalProperties.description: The binding retrieval properties associated with a CSharp function.

script.description: The CSharp code containing a single function definition.

CSharpFunctionRetrieveDefaultDefinitionP.description: The parameters needed to retrieve the default function definition for a CSharp function.

bindingRetrievalProperties.description: The binding retrieval properties associated with a CSharp function.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

etag.description: The current entity tag for the cluster. This is an opaque string. You can use it to detect whether the resource has changed between requests. You can also use it in the If-Match or If-None-Match headers for write operations for optimistic concurrency.

sku.description: The SKU (Stock Keeping Unit) assigned to this resource.

ClusterInfo.description: The properties associated with a Stream Analytics cluster.

id.description: Resource ID of the streaming job.

streamingUnits.description: The number of streaming units that are used by the streaming job.

jobState.description: The current execution state of the streaming job.

ClusterListResult.description: The response of a Cluster list operation.

value.description: The Cluster items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

ClusterProperties.description: The properties associated with a Stream Analytics cluster.

createdDate.description: The date this cluster was created.

provisioningState.description: The status of the cluster provisioning. The three terminal states are: Succeeded, Failed and Canceled

capacityAllocated.description: Represents the number of streaming units currently being used on the cluster.

capacityAssigned.description: Represents the sum of the SUs of all streaming jobs associated with the cluster. If all of the jobs were running, this would be the capacity allocated.

ClusterProvisioningState.description: The status of the cluster provisioning. The three terminal states are: Succeeded, Failed and Canceled

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: The cluster provisioning succeeded.

values.name: Failed
values.description: The cluster provisioning failed.

values.name: Canceled
values.description: The cluster provisioning was canceled.

values.name: InProgress
values.description: The cluster provisioning was inprogress.

ClusterSku.description: The SKU of the cluster. This determines the size/capacity of the cluster. Required on PUT (CreateOrUpdate) requests.

name.description: Specifies the SKU name of the cluster. Required on PUT (CreateOrUpdate) requests.

capacity.description: Denotes the number of streaming units the cluster can support. Valid values for this property are multiples of 36 with a minimum value of 36 and maximum value of 216. Required on PUT (CreateOrUpdate) requests.

ClusterSkuName.description: Specifies the SKU name of the cluster. Required on PUT (CreateOrUpdate) requests.

values.name: Default
values.description: The default SKU.

CompatibilityLevel.description: Controls certain runtime behaviors of the streaming job.

CompileQuery.description: The query compilation object which defines the input, output, and transformation for the query compilation.

inputs.description: The inputs for the query compilation.

functions.description: The functions for the query compilation.

jobType.description: Describes the type of the job. Valid values are `Cloud` and 'Edge'.

Compression.description: Describes how input data is compressed

type.description: Indicates the type of compression that the input uses. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

CompressionType.description: Indicates the type of compression that the input uses. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

ContentStoragePolicy.description: Valid values are JobStorageAccount and SystemAccount. If set to JobStorageAccount, this requires the user to also specify jobStorageAccount property. .

CsvSerialization.description: Describes how data from an input is serialized or how data is serialized when written to an output in CSV format.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with the CSV serialization type. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

CsvSerializationProperties.description: The properties that are associated with the CSV serialization type.

fieldDelimiter.description: Specifies the delimiter that will be used to separate comma-separated value (CSV) records. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/streamanalytics/stream-analytics-input or https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/streamanalytics/stream-analytics-output for a list of supported values. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

encoding.description: Specifies the encoding of the incoming data in the case of input and the encoding of outgoing data in the case of output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

CustomClrSerialization.description: Describes how data from an input is serialized or how data is serialized when written to an output in custom format.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with the CustomClr serialization type. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

CustomClrSerializationProperties.description: The properties that are associated with the CustomClr serialization type.

DiagnosticCondition.description: Condition applicable to the resource, or to the job overall, that warrant customer attention.

since.description: The UTC timestamp of when the condition started. Customers should be able to find a corresponding event in the ops log around this time.

message.description: The human-readable message describing the condition in detail. Localized in the Accept-Language of the client request.

Diagnostics.description: Describes conditions applicable to the Input, Output, or the job overall, that warrant customer attention.

conditions.description: A collection of zero or more conditions applicable to the resource, or to the job overall, that warrant customer attention.

DocumentDbOutputDataSource.description: Describes a DocumentDB output data source.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with a DocumentDB output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

DocumentDbOutputDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a DocumentDB output.

accountId.description: The DocumentDB account name or ID. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

accountKey.description: The account key for the DocumentDB account. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

database.description: The name of the DocumentDB database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

collectionNamePattern.description: The collection name pattern for the collections to be used. The collection name format can be constructed using the optional {partition} token, where partitions start from 0. See the DocumentDB section of https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/streamanalytics/stream-analytics-output for more information. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

partitionKey.description: The name of the field in output events used to specify the key for partitioning output across collections. If 'collectionNamePattern' contains the {partition} token, this property is required to be specified.

documentId.description: The name of the field in output events used to specify the primary key which insert or update operations are based on.

Encoding.description: Specifies the encoding of the incoming data in the case of input and the encoding of outgoing data in the case of output.

EventGridStreamInputDataSource.description: Describes an event grid input data source that contains stream data.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with an event grid input containing stream data.

EventGridStreamInputDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with an event grid input containing stream data.

subscriber.description: Subscribers for the Event Grid. Currently only EventHub Subscriber is supported.

schema.description: Indicates the Event Grid schema type.

storageAccounts.description: A list of one or more Azure Storage accounts. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

eventTypes.description: List of Event Types that are supported by the Event Grid adapter.

EventHubDataSourceProperties.description: The common properties that are associated with Event Hub data sources.

eventHubName.description: The name of the Event Hub. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

partitionCount.description: The partition count of the event hub data source. Range 1 - 256.

EventHubOutputDataSource.description: Describes an Event Hub output data source.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with an Event Hub output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

EventHubOutputDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with an Event Hub output.

partitionKey.description: The key/column that is used to determine to which partition to send event data.

propertyColumns.description: The properties associated with this Event Hub output.

EventHubStreamInputDataSource.description: Describes an Event Hub input data source that contains stream data.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with an Event Hub input containing stream data. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

EventHubStreamInputDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a Event Hub input containing stream data.

consumerGroupName.description: The name of an Event Hub Consumer Group that should be used to read events from the Event Hub. Specifying distinct consumer group names for multiple inputs allows each of those inputs to receive the same events from the Event Hub. If not specified, the input uses the Event Hubs default consumer group.

prefetchCount.description: The number of messages that the message receiver can simultaneously request.

EventHubV2OutputDataSource.description: Describes an Event Hub output data source.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with an Event Hub output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

EventHubV2StreamInputDataSource.description: Describes an Event Hub input data source that contains stream data.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with an Event Hub input containing stream data. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

EventSerializationType.description: Indicates the type of serialization that the input or output uses. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

EventsOutOfOrderPolicy.description: Indicates the policy to apply to events that arrive out of order in the input event stream.

External.description: The storage account where the custom code artifacts are located.

storageAccount.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure Storage account

refreshConfiguration.description: The refresh parameters for any/all updatable user defined functions present in the job config.

Function.description: A function object, containing all information associated with the named function. All functions are contained under a streaming job.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

FunctionBinding.description: The physical binding of the function. For example, in the Azure Machine Learning web services case, this describes the endpoint.

output.description: Describes the output of a function.

binding.description: The physical binding of the function. For example, in the Azure Machine Learning web services case, this describes the endpoint.

FunctionInput.description: Describes one input parameter of a function.

dataType.description: The (Azure Stream Analytics supported) data type of the function input parameter. A list of valid Azure Stream Analytics data types are described at https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn835065.aspx

isConfigurationParameter.description: A flag indicating if the parameter is a configuration parameter. True if this input parameter is expected to be a constant. Default is false.

FunctionListResult.description: The response of a Function list operation.

value.description: The Function items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

FunctionOutput.description: Describes the output of a function.

dataType.description: The (Azure Stream Analytics supported) data type of the function output. A list of valid Azure Stream Analytics data types are described at https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn835065.aspx

FunctionProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a function.

etag.description: The current entity tag for the function. This is an opaque string. You can use it to detect whether the resource has changed between requests. You can also use it in the If-Match or If-None-Match headers for write operations for optimistic concurrency.

FunctionRetrieveDefaultDefinitionParamet.description: Parameters used to specify the type of function to retrieve the default definition for.

GatewayMessageBusOutputDataSource.description: Describes a Gateway Message Bus output data source.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with a Gateway Message Bus output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

GatewayMessageBusOutputDataSourcePropert.description: The properties that are associated with a Gateway Message Bus.

GatewayMessageBusSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a gateway message bus datasource.

topic.description: The name of the Service Bus topic.

GatewayMessageBusStreamInputDataSource.description: Describes a blob input data source that contains stream data.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with a gateway message bus input containing stream data.

GatewayMessageBusStreamInputDataSourcePr.description: The properties that are associated with a gateway message bus input containing stream data.

Input.description: An input object, containing all information associated with the named input. All inputs are contained under a streaming job.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

InputListResult.description: The response of a Input list operation.

value.description: The Input items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

InputProperties.description: The properties that are associated with an input.

serialization.description: Describes how data from an input is serialized or how data is serialized when written to an output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

diagnostics.description: Describes conditions applicable to the Input, Output, or the job overall, that warrant customer attention.

etag.description: The current entity tag for the input. This is an opaque string. You can use it to detect whether the resource has changed between requests. You can also use it in the If-Match or If-None-Match headers for write operations for optimistic concurrency.

compression.description: Describes how input data is compressed

partitionKey.description: partitionKey Describes a key in the input data which is used for partitioning the input data

watermarkSettings.description: Settings which determine whether to read watermark events.

InputWatermarkProperties.description: Settings which determine whether to read watermark events.

IoTHubStreamInputDataSource.description: Describes an IoT Hub input data source that contains stream data.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with an IoT Hub input containing stream data. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

IoTHubStreamInputDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a IoT Hub input containing stream data.

iotHubNamespace.description: The name or the URI of the IoT Hub. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

sharedAccessPolicyName.description: The shared access policy name for the IoT Hub. This policy must contain at least the Service connect permission. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

sharedAccessPolicyKey.description: The shared access policy key for the specified shared access policy. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

consumerGroupName.description: The name of an IoT Hub Consumer Group that should be used to read events from the IoT Hub. If not specified, the input uses the Iot Hubs default consumer group.

endpoint.description: The IoT Hub endpoint to connect to (ie. messages/events, messages/operationsMonitoringEvents, etc.).

JavaScriptFunctionBinding.description: The binding to a JavaScript function.

properties.description: The binding properties associated with a JavaScript function.

JavaScriptFunctionBindingProperties.description: The binding properties associated with a JavaScript function.

script.description: The JavaScript code containing a single function definition. For example: 'function (x, y) { return x + y; }'

JavaScriptFunctionBindingRetrievalProper.description: The binding retrieval properties associated with a JavaScript function.

script.description: The JavaScript code containing a single function definition. For example: 'function (x, y) { return x + y; }'.

JavaScriptFunctionRetrieveDefaultDefinit.description: The parameters needed to retrieve the default function definition for a JavaScript function.

bindingRetrievalProperties.description: The binding retrieval properties associated with a JavaScript function.

JobState.description: The current execution state of the streaming job.

values.name: Created
values.description: The job is currently in the Created state.

values.name: Starting
values.description: The job is currently in the Starting state.

values.name: Running
values.description: The job is currently in the Running state.

values.name: Stopping
values.description: The job is currently in the Stopping state.

values.name: Stopped
values.description: The job is currently in the Stopped state.

values.name: Deleting
values.description: The job is currently in the Deleting state.

values.name: Failed
values.description: The job is currently in the Failed state.

values.name: Degraded
values.description: The job is currently in the Degraded state.

values.name: Restarting
values.description: The job is currently in the Restarting state.

values.name: Scaling
values.description: The job is currently in the Scaling state.

JobStorageAccount.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure Storage account with MSI

JobType.description: Describes the type of the job. Valid modes are `Cloud` and 'Edge'.

JsonOutputSerializationFormat.description: Specifies the format of the JSON the output will be written in. The currently supported values are 'lineSeparated' indicating the output will be formatted by having each JSON object separated by a new line and 'array' indicating the output will be formatted as an array of JSON objects.

JsonSerialization.description: Describes how data from an input is serialized or how data is serialized when written to an output in JSON format.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with the JSON serialization type. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

JsonSerializationProperties.description: The properties that are associated with the JSON serialization type.

encoding.description: Specifies the encoding of the incoming data in the case of input and the encoding of outgoing data in the case of output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

format.description: This property only applies to JSON serialization of outputs only. It is not applicable to inputs. This property specifies the format of the JSON the output will be written in. The currently supported values are 'lineSeparated' indicating the output will be formatted by having each JSON object separated by a new line and 'array' indicating the output will be formatted as an array of JSON objects. Default value is 'lineSeparated' if left null.

lastUpdateTime.description: The time that the last update happened.

OAuthBasedDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with data sources that use OAuth as their authentication model.

refreshToken.description: A refresh token that can be used to obtain a valid access token that can then be used to authenticate with the data source. A valid refresh token is currently only obtainable via the Azure Portal. It is recommended to put a dummy string value here when creating the data source and then going to the Azure Portal to authenticate the data source which will update this property with a valid refresh token. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

tokenUserPrincipalName.description: The user principal name (UPN) of the user that was used to obtain the refresh token. Use this property to help remember which user was used to obtain the refresh token.

tokenUserDisplayName.description: The user display name of the user that was used to obtain the refresh token. Use this property to help remember which user was used to obtain the refresh token.

Output.description: An output object, containing all information associated with the named output. All outputs are contained under a streaming job.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

OutputDataSource.description: Describes the data source that output will be written to.

OutputErrorPolicy.description: Indicates the policy to apply to events that arrive at the output and cannot be written to the external storage due to being malformed (missing column values, column values of wrong type or size).

OutputListResult.description: The response of a Output list operation.

value.description: The Output items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

OutputProperties.description: The properties that are associated with an output.

datasource.description: Describes the data source that output will be written to. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

timeWindow.description: The time frame for filtering Stream Analytics job outputs.

sizeWindow.description: The size window to constrain a Stream Analytics output to.

serialization.description: Describes how data from an input is serialized or how data is serialized when written to an output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

diagnostics.description: Describes conditions applicable to the Input, Output, or the job overall, that warrant customer attention.

etag.description: The current entity tag for the output. This is an opaque string. You can use it to detect whether the resource has changed between requests. You can also use it in the If-Match or If-None-Match headers for write operations for optimistic concurrency.

lastOutputEventTimestamps.description: A list of the last output event times for each output partition. The index of the array corresponds to the partition number.

watermarkSettings.description: Settings which determine whether to send watermarks to downstream.

OutputStartMode.description: Value may be JobStartTime, CustomTime, or LastOutputEventTime to indicate whether the starting point of the output event stream should start whenever the job is started, start at a custom user time stamp specified via the outputStartTime property, or start from the last event output time.

OutputWatermarkProperties.description: Settings which determine whether to send watermarks to downstream.

maxWatermarkDifferenceAcrossPartitions.description: Describes the maximal delta between the fastest and slowest partitions, so the out of order window that catches all necessary events in downstream jobs is well defined.

PagedClusterJob.description: A list of streaming jobs. Populated by a List operation.

value.description: The ClusterJob items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

ParquetSerialization.description: Describes how data from an input is serialized or how data is serialized when written to an output in Parquet format.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with the Parquet serialization type. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

PostgreSQLDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure SQL database data source.

server.description: The name of the SQL server containing the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

database.description: The name of the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

table.description: The name of the table in the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

user.description: The user name that will be used to connect to the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

password.description: The password that will be used to connect to the Azure SQL database. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

maxWriterCount.description: Max Writer count, currently only 1(single writer) and 0(based on query partition) are available. Optional on PUT requests.

PostgreSQLOutputDataSource.description: Describes a PostgreSQL output data source.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with a PostgreSQL output data source. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

PostgreSQLOutputDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a PostgreSQL output.

PowerBIOutputDataSource.description: Describes a Power BI output data source.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with a Power BI output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

PowerBIOutputDataSourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a Power BI output.

dataset.description: The name of the Power BI dataset. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

table.description: The name of the Power BI table under the specified dataset. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

groupId.description: The ID of the Power BI group.

groupName.description: The name of the Power BI group. Use this property to help remember which specific Power BI group id was used.

PrivateEndpoint.description: Complete information about the private endpoint.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

etag.description: Unique opaque string (generally a GUID) that represents the metadata state of the resource (private endpoint) and changes whenever the resource is updated. Required on PUT (CreateOrUpdate) requests.

PrivateEndpointListResult.description: The response of a PrivateEndpoint list operation.

value.description: The PrivateEndpoint items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

PrivateEndpointProperties.description: The properties associated with a private endpoint.

createdDate.description: The date when this private endpoint was created.

manualPrivateLinkServiceConnections.description: A list of connections to the remote resource. Immutable after it is set.

PrivateLinkConnectionState.description: A collection of read-only information about the state of the connection to the private remote resource.

status.description: Indicates whether the connection has been Approved/Rejected/Removed by the owner of the remote resource/service.

description.description: The reason for approval/rejection of the connection.

actionsRequired.description: A message indicating if changes on the service provider require any updates on the consumer.

PrivateLinkServiceConnection.description: A grouping of information about the connection to the remote resource.

properties.description: Bag of properties defining a privatelinkServiceConnection.

PrivateLinkServiceConnectionProperties.description: Bag of properties defining a privatelinkServiceConnection.

privateLinkServiceId.description: The resource id of the private link service. Required on PUT (CreateOrUpdate) requests.

groupIds.description: The ID(s) of the group(s) obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to. Required on PUT (CreateOrUpdate) requests.

requestMessage.description: A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with this connection request. Restricted to 140 chars.

privateLinkServiceConnectionState.description: A collection of read-only information about the state of the connection to the private remote resource.

QueryCompilationError.description: An error produced by the compiler.

message.description: The content of the error message.

startLine.description: Describes the error location in the original query. Not set if isGlobal is true.

startColumn.description: Describes the error location in the original query. Not set if isGlobal is true.

endLine.description: Describes the error location in the original query. Not set if isGlobal is true.

endColumn.description: Describes the error location in the original query. Not set if isGlobal is true.

isGlobal.description: Whether the error is not for a specific part but for the entire query.

QueryCompilationResult.description: The result of the query compilation request.

errors.description: Error messages produced by the compiler.

warnings.description: Warning messages produced by the compiler.

inputs.description: All input names used by the query.

outputs.description: All output names used by the query.

functions.description: All function names used by the query.

QueryFunction.description: A function for the query compilation.

bindingType.description: The type of the function binding.

QueryInput.description: An input for the query compilation.

type.description: The type of the input, can be Stream or Reference.

QueryTestingResult.description: The result of the query testing request.

status.description: The status of the query testing request.

outputUri.description: The SAS URL to the outputs payload.

QueryTestingResultStatus.description: The status of the query testing request.

values.name: Started
values.description: The query testing operation was initiated.

values.name: Success
values.description: The query testing operation succeeded.

values.name: CompilerError
values.description: The query testing operation failed due to a compiler error.

values.name: RuntimeError
values.description: The query testing operation failed due to a runtime error.

values.name: Timeout
values.description: The query testing operation failed due to a timeout.

values.name: UnknownError
values.description: The query testing operation failed due to an unknown error .

RawInputDatasourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a raw input.

payload.description: The JSON serialized content of the input data. Either payload or payloadUri must be set, but not both.

payloadUri.description: The SAS URL to a blob containing the JSON serialized content of the input data. Either payload or payloadUri must be set, but not both.

RawOutputDatasource.description: Describes a raw output data source. This data source type is only applicable/usable when using the query testing API. You cannot create a job with this data source type or add an output of this data source type to an existing job.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with a raw output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

RawOutputDatasourceProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a raw output.

payloadUri.description: The SAS URL to a blob where the output should be written. If this property is not set, output data will be written into a temporary storage, and a SAS URL to that temporary storage will be included in the result.

RawReferenceInputDataSource.description: Describes a raw input data source that contains reference data. This data source type is only applicable/usable when using the query testing API. You cannot create a job with this data source type or add an input of this data source type to an existing job.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with a raw input containing reference data. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

RawStreamInputDataSource.description: Describes a raw input data source that contains stream data. This data source type is only applicable/usable when using the query testing API. You cannot create a job with this data source type or add an input of this data source type to an existing job.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with a raw input. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

ReferenceInputDataSource.description: Describes an input data source that contains reference data.

ReferenceInputProperties.description: The properties that are associated with an input containing reference data.

datasource.description: Describes an input data source that contains reference data. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

RefreshConfiguration.description: The refresh parameters for any/all updatable user defined functions present in the job config.

pathPattern.description: The blob path pattern. Not a regular expression. It represents a pattern against which blob names will be matched to determine whether or not they should be included as input or output to the job. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/streamanalytics/stream-analytics-input or https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/streamanalytics/stream-analytics-output for a more detailed explanation and example.

dateFormat.description: The date format. Wherever {date} appears in pathPattern, the value of this property is used as the date format instead.

timeFormat.description: The time format. Wherever {time} appears in pathPattern, the value of this property is used as the time format instead.

refreshType.description: This property indicates which data refresh option to use, Blocking or Nonblocking.

RefreshType.description: Indicates the type of data refresh option.

id.description: Fully qualified resource Id for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

type.description: The type of the resource. Ex- Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines or Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts.

ResourceTestStatus.description: Describes the status of the test operation along with error information, if applicable.

status.description: The status of the test operation.

SampleInput.description: The stream analytics input to sample.

input.description: The stream analytics input to sample.

compatibilityLevel.description: Defaults to the default ASA job compatibility level. Today it is 1.2

eventsUri.description: The SAS URI of the storage blob for service to write the sampled events to. If this parameter is not provided, service will write events to he system account and share a temporary SAS URI to it.

SampleInputResult.description: The result of the sample input request.

status.description: The status of the sample input request.

diagnostics.description: Diagnostics messages. E.g. message indicating some partitions from the input have no data.

eventsDownloadUrl.description: A SAS URL to download the sampled input data.

lastArrivalTime.description: The timestamp for the last event in the data. It is in DateTime format.

SampleInputResultStatus.description: The status of the sample input request.

values.name: ReadAllEventsInRange
values.description: The sample input operation successfully read all the events in the range.

values.name: NoEventsFoundInRange
values.description: The sample input operation found no events in the range.

values.name: ErrorConnectingToInput
values.description: The sample input operation failed to connect to the input.

ScalarFunctionProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a scalar function.

ScaleStreamingJobParameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Scale Streaming Job operation.

streamingUnits.description: Specifies the number of streaming units that the streaming job will scale to.

Serialization.description: Describes how data from an input is serialized or how data is serialized when written to an output.

ServiceBusDataSourceProperties.description: The common properties that are associated with Service Bus data sources (Queues, Topics, Event Hubs, etc.).

serviceBusNamespace.description: The namespace that is associated with the desired Event Hub, Service Bus Queue, Service Bus Topic, etc. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

sharedAccessPolicyName.description: The shared access policy name for the Event Hub, Service Bus Queue, Service Bus Topic, etc. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

sharedAccessPolicyKey.description: The shared access policy key for the specified shared access policy. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

ServiceBusQueueOutputDataSource.description: Describes a Service Bus Queue output data source.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with a Service Bus Queue output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

ServiceBusQueueOutputDataSourcePropertie.description: The properties that are associated with a Service Bus Queue output.

queueName.description: The name of the Service Bus Queue. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

propertyColumns.description: A string array of the names of output columns to be attached to Service Bus messages as custom properties.

systemPropertyColumns.description: The system properties associated with the Service Bus Queue. The following system properties are supported: ReplyToSessionId, ContentType, To, Subject, CorrelationId, TimeToLive, PartitionKey, SessionId, ScheduledEnqueueTime, MessageId, ReplyTo, Label, ScheduledEnqueueTimeUtc.

ServiceBusTopicOutputDataSource.description: Describes a Service Bus Topic output data source.

properties.description: The properties that are associated with a Service Bus Topic output. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

ServiceBusTopicOutputDataSourcePropertie.description: The properties that are associated with a Service Bus Topic output.

topicName.description: The name of the Service Bus Topic. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

propertyColumns.description: A string array of the names of output columns to be attached to Service Bus messages as custom properties.

systemPropertyColumns.description: The system properties associated with the Service Bus Topic Output. The following system properties are supported: ReplyToSessionId, ContentType, To, Subject, CorrelationId, TimeToLive, PartitionKey, SessionId, ScheduledEnqueueTime, MessageId, ReplyTo, Label, ScheduledEnqueueTimeUtc.

Sku.description: The properties that are associated with a SKU.

name.description: The name of the SKU. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

SkuName.description: The name of the SKU. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

StartStreamingJobParameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Start Streaming Job operation.

outputStartMode.description: Value may be JobStartTime, CustomTime, or LastOutputEventTime to indicate whether the starting point of the output event stream should start whenever the job is started, start at a custom user time stamp specified via the outputStartTime property, or start from the last event output time.

outputStartTime.description: Value is either an ISO-8601 formatted time stamp that indicates the starting point of the output event stream, or null to indicate that the output event stream will start whenever the streaming job is started. This property must have a value if outputStartMode is set to CustomTime.

StorageAccount.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure Storage account

accountName.description: The name of the Azure Storage account. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

accountKey.description: The account key for the Azure Storage account. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

StreamInputDataSource.description: Describes an input data source that contains stream data.

StreamInputProperties.description: The properties that are associated with an input containing stream data.

datasource.description: Describes an input data source that contains stream data. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

StreamingJob.description: A streaming job object, containing all information associated with the named streaming job.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

identity.description: The managed service identities assigned to this resource.

StreamingJobListResult.description: The response of a StreamingJob list operation.

value.description: The StreamingJob items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

StreamingJobProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a streaming job.

sku.description: Describes the SKU of the streaming job. Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

jobId.description: A GUID uniquely identifying the streaming job. This GUID is generated upon creation of the streaming job.

provisioningState.description: Describes the provisioning status of the streaming job.

jobState.description: Describes the state of the streaming job.

jobType.description: Describes the type of the job. Valid modes are `Cloud` and 'Edge'.

outputStartMode.description: This property should only be utilized when it is desired that the job be started immediately upon creation. Value may be JobStartTime, CustomTime, or LastOutputEventTime to indicate whether the starting point of the output event stream should start whenever the job is started, start at a custom user time stamp specified via the outputStartTime property, or start from the last event output time.

outputStartTime.description: Value is either an ISO-8601 formatted time stamp that indicates the starting point of the output event stream, or null to indicate that the output event stream will start whenever the streaming job is started. This property must have a value if outputStartMode is set to CustomTime.

lastOutputEventTime.description: Value is either an ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating the last output event time of the streaming job or null indicating that output has not yet been produced. In case of multiple outputs or multiple streams, this shows the latest value in that set.

eventsOutOfOrderPolicy.description: Indicates the policy to apply to events that arrive out of order in the input event stream.

outputErrorPolicy.description: Indicates the policy to apply to events that arrive at the output and cannot be written to the external storage due to being malformed (missing column values, column values of wrong type or size).

eventsOutOfOrderMaxDelayInSeconds.description: The maximum tolerable delay in seconds where out-of-order events can be adjusted to be back in order.

eventsLateArrivalMaxDelayInSeconds.description: The maximum tolerable delay in seconds where events arriving late could be included.  Supported range is -1 to 1814399 (20.23:59:59 days) and -1 is used to specify wait indefinitely. If the property is absent, it is interpreted to have a value of -1.

dataLocale.description: The data locale of the stream analytics job. Value should be the name of a supported .NET Culture from the set https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.globalization.culturetypes(v=vs.110).aspx. Defaults to 'en-US' if none specified.

compatibilityLevel.description: Controls certain runtime behaviors of the streaming job.

createdDate.description: Value is an ISO-8601 formatted UTC timestamp indicating when the streaming job was created.

inputs.description: A list of one or more inputs to the streaming job. The name property for each input is required when specifying this property in a PUT request. This property cannot be modify via a PATCH operation. You must use the PATCH API available for the individual input.

transformation.description: Indicates the query and the number of streaming units to use for the streaming job. The name property of the transformation is required when specifying this property in a PUT request. This property cannot be modify via a PATCH operation. You must use the PATCH API available for the individual transformation.

outputs.description: A list of one or more outputs for the streaming job. The name property for each output is required when specifying this property in a PUT request. This property cannot be modify via a PATCH operation. You must use the PATCH API available for the individual output.

functions.description: A list of one or more functions for the streaming job. The name property for each function is required when specifying this property in a PUT request. This property cannot be modify via a PATCH operation. You must use the PATCH API available for the individual transformation.

etag.description: The current entity tag for the streaming job. This is an opaque string. You can use it to detect whether the resource has changed between requests. You can also use it in the If-Match or If-None-Match headers for write operations for optimistic concurrency.

jobStorageAccount.description: The properties that are associated with an Azure Storage account with MSI

contentStoragePolicy.description: Valid values are JobStorageAccount and SystemAccount. If set to JobStorageAccount, this requires the user to also specify jobStorageAccount property. .

externals.description: The storage account where the custom code artifacts are located.

cluster.description: The cluster which streaming jobs will run on.

SubscriptionQuota.description: Describes the current quota for the subscription.

properties.description: Describes the properties of the quota.

SubscriptionQuotaProperties.description: Describes the properties of the quota.

maxCount.description: The max permitted usage of this resource.

currentCount.description: The current usage of this resource.

SubscriptionQuotasListResult.description: Result of the GetQuotas operation. It contains a list of quotas for the subscription in a particular region.

value.description: List of quotas for the subscription in a particular region.

TestDatasourceResult.description: The result of the test input or output request.

status.description: The status of the sample output request.

TestDatasourceResultStatus.description: The status of the test input or output request.

values.name: TestSucceeded
values.description: The test datasource operation succeeded.

values.name: TestFailed
values.description: The test datasource operation failed.

input.description: The stream analytics input to test.

output.description: The stream analytics output to test.

TestQuery.description: The request object for query testing.

diagnostics.description: Diagnostics information related to query testing.

streamingJob.description: Stream analytics job object which defines the input, output, and transformation for the query testing.

TestQueryDiagnostics.description: Diagnostics information related to query testing.

writeUri.description: The SAS URI to the container or directory.

Transformation.description: A transformation object, containing all information associated with the named transformation. All transformations are contained under a streaming job.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

TransformationProperties.description: The properties that are associated with a transformation.

streamingUnits.description: Specifies the number of streaming units that the streaming job uses.

validStreamingUnits.description: Specifies the valid streaming units a streaming job can scale to.

query.description: Specifies the query that will be run in the streaming job. You can learn more about the Stream Analytics Query Language (SAQL) here: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn834998 . Required on PUT (CreateOrReplace) requests.

etag.description: The current entity tag for the transformation. This is an opaque string. You can use it to detect whether the resource has changed between requests. You can also use it in the If-Match or If-None-Match headers for write operations for optimistic concurrency.

UpdateMode.description: Refresh modes for Stream Analytics functions.

values.name: v2021_10_01_preview
values.description: The 2021-10-01-preview API version.

values.name: v2020_03_01_preview
values.description: The 2020-03-01-preview API version.

Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.name: api-version
Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.description: The API version to use for this operation.
